drupalNodeEvent.title: Literati Lenses: Wenren Landscape in Chinese Cinema of the Mao Era

field_speakers.processed: Mia Yinxing Liu (California College of the Arts), Paola Iovene (University of Chicago)

field_organizers.processed: University of Chicago Center for East Asian Studies

field_description.processed:
Part of the East Asia by the Book! CEAS Author Talks series, this event features California College of the Arts Professor, Mia Yinxing Liu, and her book, "Literati Lenses: Wenren Landscape in Chinese Cinema of the Mao Era," Since its birth, Chinese cinema has been exploring the ways to engage with China’s art
traditions, and these engagements can range from violently iconoclastic to devotedly reverential. This book focuses on the “problematic” or even “poisonous” films, words used in official criticism from the Party’s media, and demonstrates that in these films lies the lineage between cinema and the aesthetics of traditional landscape art. This program also features University of Chicago's Paola Iovene as Discussant.
